parameters.description: The version of the API to use
parameters.name: elastic-api-version

parameters.description: The identifier for the rule.
parameters.name: id

alerts_filter.description: Defines a period that limits whether the action runs.

dsl.description: A filter written in Elasticsearch Query Domain Specific Language (DSL).

filters.description: A filter written in Elasticsearch Query Domain Specific Language (DSL) as defined in the `kbn-es-query` package.

store.description: A filter can be either specific to an application context or applied globally.

kql.description: A filter written in Kibana Query Language (KQL).

days.description: Defines the days of the week that the action can run, represented as an array of numbers. For example, `1` represents Monday. An empty array is equivalent to specifying all the days of the week.

end.description: The end of the time frame in 24-hour notation (`hh:mm`).

start.description: The start of the time frame in 24-hour notation (`hh:mm`).

timezone.description: The ISO time zone for the `hours` values. Values such as `UTC` and `UTC+1` also work but lack built-in daylight savings time support and are not recommended.

connector_type_id.description: The type of connector. This property appears in responses but cannot be set in requests.

notify_when.description: Indicates how often alerts generate actions. Valid values include: `onActionGroupChange`: Actions run when the alert status changes; `onActiveAlert`: Actions run when the alert becomes active and at each check interval while the rule conditions are met; `onThrottleInterval`: Actions run when the alert becomes active and at the interval specified in the throttle property while the rule conditions are met. NOTE: You cannot specify `notify_when` at both the rule and action level. The recommended method is to set it for each action. If you set it at the rule level then update the rule in Kibana, it is automatically changed to use action-specific values.

summary.description: Indicates whether the action is a summary.

throttle.description: The throttle interval, which defines how often an alert generates repeated actions. It is specified in seconds, minutes, hours, or days and is applicable only if 'notify_when' is set to 'onThrottleInterval'. NOTE: You cannot specify the throttle interval at both the rule and action level. The recommended method is to set it for each action. If you set it at the rule level then update the rule in Kibana, it is automatically changed to use action-specific values.

group.description: The group name, which affects when the action runs (for example, when the threshold is met or when the alert is recovered). Each rule type has a list of valid action group names. If you don't need to group actions, set to `default`.

id.description: The identifier for the connector saved object.

params.description: The parameters for the action, which are sent to the connector. The `params` are handled as Mustache templates and passed a default set of context.

use_alert_data_for_template.description: Indicates whether to use alert data as a template.

uuid.description: A universally unique identifier (UUID) for the action.

items.description: List of active snoozes for the rule.

alert_delay.description: Indicates that an alert occurs only when the specified number of consecutive runs met the rule conditions.

active.description: The number of consecutive runs that must meet the rule conditions.

api_key_created_by_user.description: Indicates whether the API key that is associated with the rule was created by the user.

api_key_owner.description: The owner of the API key that is associated with the rule and used to run background tasks.

consumer.description: The name of the application or feature that owns the rule. For example: `alerts`, `apm`, `discover`, `infrastructure`, `logs`, `metrics`, `ml`, `monitoring`, `securitySolution`, `siem`, `stackAlerts`, or `uptime`.

created_at.description: The date and time that the rule was created.

created_by.description: The identifier for the user that created the rule.

enabled.description: Indicates whether you want to run the rule on an interval basis after it is created.

last_duration.description: Duration of last execution of the rule.

last_execution_date.description: The date and time when rule was executed last.

is_snoozed_until.description: The date when the rule will no longer be snoozed.

active.description: Number of active alerts during last run.

ignored.description: Number of ignored alerts during last run.

new.description: Number of new alerts during last run.

recovered.description: Number of recovered alerts during last run.

outcome.description: Outcome of last run of the rule. Value could be succeeded, warning or failed.

items.description: Outcome message generated during last rule run.

calculated_metrics.description: Calculation of different percentiles and success ratio.

active.description: Number of active alerts during last run.

ignored.description: Number of ignored alerts during last run.

new.description: Number of new alerts during last run.

recovered.description: Number of recovered alerts during last run.

outcome.description: Outcome of last run of the rule. Value could be succeeded, warning or failed.

items.description: Outcome message generated during last rule run.

success.description: Indicates whether the rule run was successful.

duration.description: Duration of most recent rule run.

gap_duration_s.description: Duration in seconds of rule run gap.

total_alerts_created.description: Total number of alerts created during last rule run.

total_alerts_detected.description: Total number of alerts detected during last rule run.

total_indexing_duration_ms.description: Total time spent indexing documents during last rule run in milliseconds.

total_search_duration_ms.description: Total time spent performing Elasticsearch searches as measured by Kibana; includes network latency and time spent serializing or deserializing the request and response.

timestamp.description: Time of the most recent rule run.

mute_all.description: Indicates whether all alerts are muted.

items.description: List of identifiers of muted alerts.

next_run.description: Date and time of the next run of the rule.

notify_when.description: Indicates how often alerts generate actions. Valid values include: `onActionGroupChange`: Actions run when the alert status changes; `onActiveAlert`: Actions run when the alert becomes active and at each check interval while the rule conditions are met; `onThrottleInterval`: Actions run when the alert becomes active and at the interval specified in the throttle property while the rule conditions are met. NOTE: You cannot specify `notify_when` at both the rule and action level. The recommended method is to set it for each action. If you set it at the rule level then update the rule in Kibana, it is automatically changed to use action-specific values.

running.description: Indicates whether the rule is running.

interval.description: The interval is specified in seconds, minutes, hours, or days.

duration.description: Duration of the rule snooze schedule.

id.description: Identifier of the rule snooze schedule.

items.description: Indicates hours of the day to recur.
Indicates minutes of the hour to recur.
Indicates months of the year that this rule should recur.
Indicates the days of the month to recur.
Indicates seconds of the day to recur.

A positive or negative integer affecting the nth day of the month. For example, -2 combined with `byweekday` of FR is 2nd to last Friday of the month. It is recommended to not set this manually and just use `byweekday`.

Indicates the days of the week to recur or else nth-day-of-month strings. For example, "+2TU" second Tuesday of month, "-1FR" last Friday of the month, which are internally converted to a `byweekday/bysetpos` combination.
Indicates number of the week hours to recur.
Indicates the days of the year that this rule should recur.

count.description: Number of times the rule should recur until it stops.

dtstart.description: Rule start date in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

freq.description: Indicates frequency of the rule. Options are YEARLY, MONTHLY, WEEKLY, DAILY.

interval.description: Indicates the interval of frequency. For example, 1 and YEARLY is every 1 year, 2 and WEEKLY is every 2 weeks.

until.description: Recur the rule until this date.

wkst.description: Indicates the start of week, defaults to Monday.

items.description: Skips recurrence of rule on this date.
The tags for the rule.

throttle.description: Deprecated in 8.13.0. Use the `throttle` property in the action `frequency` object instead. The throttle interval, which defines how often an alert generates repeated actions. NOTE: You cannot specify the throttle interval at both the rule and action level. If you set it at the rule level then update the rule in Kibana, it is automatically changed to use action-specific values.

updated_at.description: The date and time that the rule was updated most recently.

updated_by.description: The identifier for the user that updated this rule most recently.

view_in_app_relative_url.description: Relative URL to view rule in the app.

403.description: Indicates that this call is forbidden.

404.description: Indicates a rule with the given ID does not exist.

timeframe.description: Defines a period that limits whether the action runs.

days.description: Defines the days of the week that the action can run, represented as an array of numbers. For example, `1` represents Monday. An empty array is equivalent to specifying all the days of the week.

hours.description: Defines the range of time in a day that the action can run. If the `start` value is `00:00` and the `end` value is `24:00`, actions be generated all day.

end.description: The end of the time frame in 24-hour notation (`hh:mm`).

start.description: The start of the time frame in 24-hour notation (`hh:mm`).

timezone.description: The ISO time zone for the `hours` values. Values such as `UTC` and `UTC+1` also work but lack built-in daylight savings time support and are not recommended.

notify_when.description: Indicates how often alerts generate actions. Valid values include: `onActionGroupChange`: Actions run when the alert status changes; `onActiveAlert`: Actions run when the alert becomes active and at each check interval while the rule conditions are met; `onThrottleInterval`: Actions run when the alert becomes active and at the interval specified in the throttle property while the rule conditions are met. NOTE: You cannot specify `notify_when` at both the rule and action level. The recommended method is to set it for each action. If you set it at the rule level then update the rule in Kibana, it is automatically changed to use action-specific values.

summary.description: Indicates whether the action is a summary.

throttle.description: The throttle interval, which defines how often an alert generates repeated actions. It is specified in seconds, minutes, hours, or days and is applicable only if `notify_when` is set to `onThrottleInterval`. NOTE: You cannot specify the throttle interval at both the rule and action level. The recommended method is to set it for each action. If you set it at the rule level then update the rule in Kibana, it is automatically changed to use action-specific values.

group.description: The group name, which affects when the action runs (for example, when the threshold is met or when the alert is recovered). Each rule type has a list of valid action group names. If you don't need to group actions, set to `default`.

parameters.description: Specifies which authorization checks are applied to the API call. The default value is `any`.
parameters.name: purpose

parameters.description: When enabled, the API returns any spaces that the user is authorized to access in any capacity and each space will contain the purposes for which the user is authorized. This can be useful to determine which spaces a user can read but not take a specific action in. If the security plugin is not enabled, this parameter has no effect, since no authorization checks take place. This parameter cannot be used in with the `purpose` parameter.
parameters.name: include_authorized_purposes

parameters.name: kbn-xsrf

color.description: The hexadecimal color code used in the space avatar. By default, the color is automatically generated from the space name.

items.description: The list of features that are turned off in the space.

id.description: The space ID that is part of the Kibana URL when inside the space. Space IDs are limited to lowercase alphanumeric, underscore, and hyphen characters (a-z, 0-9, _, and -). You are cannot change the ID with the update operation.

imageUrl.description: The data-URL encoded image to display in the space avatar. If specified, initials will not be displayed and the color will be visible as the background color for transparent images. For best results, your image should be 64x64. Images will not be optimized by this API call, so care should be taken when using custom images.

initials.description: One or two characters that are shown in the space avatar. By default, the initials are automatically generated from the space name.

name.description: The display name for the space.

delete.description: When you delete a space, all saved objects that belong to the space are automatically deleted, which is permanent and cannot be undone.
